job_title: Creative Copywriter in High Wycombe, England
pros:
CSSC offer a superb work-life balance and is by far and away one of the best, kindest and more caring employers I've ever worked for in over 30 years employment. The lovely people and leadership team really care about my wellbeing and it shows with the environment they foster.

They have great in-work benefits including a generous holiday entitlement and good final salary pension provision. They offer decent pay, terms and conditions including time off for family leave, wellbeing time, discounted sports and entertainment, a comfortable working environment with good blend of hybrid and WFH ability, with staff effectively choosing where they work and how they work.

The leadership and senior teams are caring and collaborative and i am empowered to stretch myself to learn new skills and find Interesting and varied work to increase my learning and keep the work varied.

Head office is close to local amenities with on-site parking. With their well established community engagement, CSSC encourage participation in helping local schools and charities with volunteering opportunities and time off to spend on local and national projections and opportunities.

As a fairly small company, career progression is limited, but possible and actively encouraged. And training is funded and sourced through good contacts allowing tremendous personal development and growth.

The whole company and every individual is passionate about colleagues, staff and member health and wellbeing and they show it every day by leading by example. The recent pandemic has highlighted huge pressures on companies to look after their staff, which CSSC has risen to meet and more than exceed my expectations, choosing to retain and retrain staff.

It's a Cliché but CSSC truly has the feel of a small intimate, family company, with the huge reach and impact of a national institution. CSSC especially represents an excellent opportunity for first time employment out of school or university or those passionate about helping others and allows excellent collaborative working practices helping to learn new skills across a range of departments.
cons: Limited on-site parking. There is also limited internal career progression due to small number of vacancies, which is mainly because very few people leave as they're so happy here.

review_title: A great company to work for
job_title: Head Of Customer Experience in High Wycombe, England
pros:
You have a good work-life balance, with the flexibility of hybrid working throughout the week. Over the past two years CSSC has risen to the challenge to ensure staff are able to have this flexibility and are constantly reviewing how this works for the benefit of the company and its staff.
The office has a fantastic atmosphere and the staff are very friendly and inclusive which gives a family feel across the company and makes you part of something unique. 
CSSC live and breathe wellbeing and this shows with the benefits included as part of your role and the values of the company. Even winning awards for Wellbeing initiatives for staff's wellbeing.
The whole company are passionate about the future of CSSC and it's members and volunteers, which has broken down siloed working across departments and teams are now collaborating together.
cons:
Some areas are under resourced due to the growth and development of the company, which means work load can be intense. However, it doesn't go un-noticed and the Executive Team and Senior Leaders work to reduce this. 
Because of this times lines on projects can be delayed and cause frustrations. 
IT is a bit of an issue. 
Onsite parking can be an issue on busy days, but there is parking in a close by carpark.
